meanings.definition: To surpass in guessing or predicting.
meanings.sent1: She always manages to outguess me when we play games.
meanings.sent2: I tried to outguess the weather, but it ended up raining anyway.
meanings.sent3: The detective was able to outguess the culprit's next move.
meanings.sent4: Trying to outguess the stock market is like trying to predict the future.
meanings.sent5: His ability to outguess his opponents made him a formidable chess player.

meanings.definition: To outwit or outsmart by guessing correctly.
meanings.sent1: He was able to outguess the quiz show contestants and win the grand prize.
meanings.sent2: The spy had to outguess the enemy agent to complete the mission.
meanings.sent3: She managed to outguess her friends in the game of charades.
meanings.sent4: Trying to outguess a master strategist is a risky endeavor.
meanings.sent5: The hacker tried to outguess the security system, but it proved to be impenetrable.
